trans-unit.source: When you create a virtual machine in the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com) using the **Resource Manager** deployment model, the portal creates a public IP resource for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: When you create a virtual machine in the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com) using the **Resource Manager** deployment model, the portal creates a public IP resource for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can use this IP address to remotely access the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You can use this IP address to remotely access the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Although the portal does not create a [fully qualified domain name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fully_qualified_domain_name) or FQDN, by default, it is extremely easy to create one once the virtual machine is created.
trans-unit.target: Although the portal does not create a [fully qualified domain name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fully_qualified_domain_name) or FQDN, by default, it is extremely easy to create one once the virtual machine is created.

trans-unit.source: This article demonstrates the steps to create a DNS name or FQDN.
trans-unit.target: This article demonstrates the steps to create a DNS name or FQDN.

trans-unit.source: The article assumes that you have logged in to your subscription in the portal, and created a virtual machine with the available images, using the **Resource Manager**.
trans-unit.target: The article assumes that you have logged in to your subscription in the portal, and created a virtual machine with the available images, using the **Resource Manager**.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps once your virtual machine starts running.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps once your virtual machine starts running.

trans-unit.source: View the virtual machine settings on the portal and click on the Public IP address.
trans-unit.target: View the virtual machine settings on the portal and click on the Public IP address.

trans-unit.source: Note that the DNS name for the Public IP is blank.
trans-unit.target: Note that the DNS name for the Public IP is blank.

trans-unit.source: Click **All settings** for the Public IP blade.
trans-unit.target: Click **All settings** for the Public IP blade.

trans-unit.source: Open the **Configuration** tab in the Public IP Settings.
trans-unit.target: Open the **Configuration** tab in the Public IP Settings.

trans-unit.source: Enter the desired DNS name label and **Save** this configuration.
trans-unit.target: Enter the desired DNS name label and **Save** this configuration.

trans-unit.source: The Public IP resource will now show this new DNS label on its blade.
trans-unit.target: The Public IP resource will now show this new DNS label on its blade.

trans-unit.source: Close the Public IP blades and go back to the virtual machine blade in the portal.
trans-unit.target: Close the Public IP blades and go back to the virtual machine blade in the portal.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the DNS name/FQDN appears next to the IP address for the Public IP resource.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the DNS name/FQDN appears next to the IP address for the Public IP resource.
